claim: Opening ceremony of 2012 London Olympics was a projection of coronavirus pandemic. The hospital beds apperaing on the scene during the opening show and Boris Johnson in a hospital bed prove that the spread of the disease was planned in advance.
label: FALSE

claim: An audio message circulating in India claimed that in Wuhan, China, many people recovered from coronavirus without going to hospital after drinking ot water and steam inhalation.
label: Misleading

claim: A picture of an empty field hospital in Brazil. Post claims that COVID-19 crisis is not real.
label: misleading

claim: Picture of a hospital in Santo André, Brazil. It says in the caption that, despite the COVID-19 crisis, the hospital has no patients.
label: FALSE

claim: Hospitals in the United States get paid $750 for patients who die from the flu, $17,500 for COVID-19.
label: FALSE

claim: A video of a woman claiming that pneumonia, HIV, and cardiovascular patients are being treated together in a hospital’s COVID-19 isolation ward has been viewed thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook and Twitter. The footage includes superimposed text that claims the hospital is the Abbasi Shaheed Hospital, a state-run facility in the Pakistani city of Karachi.
label: FALSE

claim: A photo of a bill for more than SGD $180,000 (USD $128,000) from a Singapore hospital has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim the invoice was given to a coronavirus patient after treatment for the disease COVID-19.
label: FALSE

claim: Doctors encouraged by hospitals and AMA to overcount COVID-19 deaths.
label: FALSE

claim: Use of hydroxycholoroquine is restricted to military hospitals in France.
label: FALSE

claim: The US hospitals inflate the number of COVID-19 cases and deaths so they can receive more money.
label: No evidence

claim: Multiple Facebook posts shared hundreds of times claim doctors from the National Taiwan University Hospital (NTUH) in Taipei have found that COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus, is a combination of AIDS and SARS.
label: FALSE

claim: North Carolina’s health department is “telling hospitals that if they decide to do elective surgeries, they won’t be eligible to receive (protective equipment) from the state.”
label: FALSE

claim: Komal Mishra, a staff nurse at a hospital in Pune, India died while due to coronavirus.
label: FALSE

claim: A video shows an empty hospital. It states that, although Globo said there were already 7 patients at a temporary COVID-19 hospital built in Fortaleza, Brazil, the video proves it is still not working.
label: FALSE

claim: COVID-19 patients in Gujarat are being segregated on the basis of religion at Ahmedabad Civil Hospital.
label: FALSE
